Key Match Events: The Knicks were outscored by 26 points in Karl-Anthony Towns' 32 minutes.
The Knicks were outscored by 26 points in Karl-Anthony Towns' 32 minutes.
The Knicks threw just 242 passes — 40 fewer than their season average.
Jalen Brunson, who logged 42 minutes and faltered down the stretch, averaged over seven seconds with the ball per touch (a second more than his season average).
Pre-Game Insights: Karl-Anthony Towns said he’s seen a lot of defenses in his career, so he’s just going to be prepared for whatever the defense and the opponent’s game plan is.
Post-Match Reflections: Josh Hart said the Knicks have to get more movement into their offense and can’t just try to consistently chase mismatches.
Josh Hart said the Knicks probably complained a little bit too much to the referees, which let them get out of the game.
Karl-Anthony Towns said the loss was an expensive lesson, but they will continue to grow and learn from it.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks lost to the Rockets 109-97.
The Knicks scored a season-low 97 points.
The Knicks were too consumed with hunting mismatches and didn’t stick with what they were good at.
The Knicks were good at cutting and ball movement against Detroit, but not against Houston.
Others: Dillon Brooks was used to agitate Karl-Anthony Towns and throw a curveball that the Knicks chased way out of the zone.
Post-Match Quotes: Josh Hart: ‘We’ve got to get more movement into it. Even when we got the mismatch we wanted, it was very stagnant.’
Josh Hart: ‘We probably complained a little bit too much [to the referees], let that take us out of the game.’
Karl-Anthony Towns: ‘I’ve seen a lot of defenses in my career, so I’m just going to be prepared for whatever the defense and the opponent’s game plan is.’
Karl-Anthony Towns: ‘We’re a team that’s growing and we’re going to continue to grow until the last horn.’
Jalen Brunson: ‘Find something that we’re good at, and stick with it.’
